data.text: @EW I'm not waching the fake Charmed

@KiraJW @milegend @EW When it comes to women and the depiction of violence towards women learning Gail Simone's "Women in Fridges" trope is a highly recommend. The representation and calling out the unreal amount of violence of using women and their deaths to further the male characters story. It's ew
@milegend @David_Angle @EW Probably because #metoo was started 10 years ago by a black woman named Tarana Burke.
@milegend @David_Angle @EW And that's great for white women.  They neglected non-white women, which is purposeful, which is a massive problem.  That's all I'm saying.

@David_Angle @milegend @EW I never said anything that wasnt classy.  I was never into #Charmed. I might check out the new version.  But I still think it didn't need to be a reboot.  They could've just made an original show about witches.  Then they wouldn't be chained to the old mythology.

@KiraJW @milegend @EW That's not true at all. It was far more progressive for Blacks on tv thankfully. But after just escaping the 80s and the aids epidemic we were portrayed heavily as gays who were buryed on tv to provide a not so happy ending while making people questionably feel for the character.

@KiraJW @milegend @EW Hey let's keep it classy. We here cuz of Shannon and Charmed. (Kinda loved Paige more than Prue if honest). But hey for women it's amazing. It's a great step compared to shows where men dominated as the lead. Just not completely PRO LGBT. A shame. 😕

@milegend @David_Angle @EW Also, black shows were incredibly popular in broadcast networks just a few years before #Charmed debuted. So it really made no sense for them to not try to cultivate that audience at some point, like other WB shows had.
@David_Angle @milegend @EW I wasn't talking about LGBT but Will and Grace literally debuted the same year as Charmed.  😂

@milegend @David_Angle @EW We aren't on Tumblr love.  And it's not remotely woke to say "this show set in New York-one of the most diverse cities in the world-probably shouldn't have all white people in it." I'm old enough to remember these shows and how ridiculous it was when they had all white casts

@KiraJW @milegend @EW The 90s wasn't a complete acceptable time for LGBTS on tv. We were treated very differently. I do blame it on the times of LGBTS on tv but not representable of actual LGBTS living in the 90s trust me I was not bashing Charmed at all.
@milegend @David_Angle @EW A different time?  It was 1998. That's not an excuse.
@milegend @EW That's not remotely what I said 😂🙄

@milegend @KiraJW @EW Only problem I had was that it's only lesbian they killed. Thus furthering the "Bury The Gays" trope. But I agree this show was super feminist. It's all about sisterhood. https://t.co/cizyrCCotg

@EW Good reason: they didn't even TRY consulting the original. They blatantly ignored them. So the fans are understandably irked. Unlike Chilling Adventures of Sabrina which IS trying to tell a clear vision of the classic witch Charmed is just blatantly feeling like a rip off.
@kaitcarter_ @EW Probably from the cancer she had

@EW Heathers has already been shot and canceled for a 2nd season. So she just doesnt want to be associated with a reboot that has never invited or welcomed any of the original women. Here is all of the interviews sourced with dates. Write abt that EW https://t.co/HTqx5bcPN4
@EW The original Charmed wasn't feminist at all.  No major characters were women of color.  If you're not inclusive, you're not doing it right.
